definition: to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)
portrait/to do a portrait of sb
likeness of a person (sketch, photo, sculpture etc)

sentences.english: Yeah, like gentle breeze blowing through the cheeks, the hair dancing in the wind.
sentences.chinese: 是的，像微风吹过面颊，因为发梢在跳舞。

sentences.english: Shown below are specific features of edge-to-edge holographic CD's.
sentences.chinese: 下面介绍边到边全息图像光盘的具体特征。

sentences.english: It sounds like the crying of a baby.
sentences.chinese: 听起来像小孩的哭泣声。

sentences.english: What did these tattoos look like?
sentences.chinese: 这些纹身看起来像什么？

sentences.english: Your condescension, as always, is much appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 像往常一样，你的屈尊俯就总是让人感激。

sentences.english: This feels like the perfect place for me right now.
sentences.chinese: 这种感觉就像那个完美的地方对我一样。

sentences.english: I think the EDG probably uses a low astigmatism eyepiece design like the SE.
sentences.chinese: 我想EDG可能使用了象SE一样的低像散目镜设计。

sentences.english: Like living in the mountains from the solitary who had every day.
sentences.chinese: 像躲避在深山老林居住的独行者过每天。

sentences.english: Which, briefly, is like an explosion in a spear factory.
sentences.chinese: 简单地说，就像兵工厂发生了爆炸。

sentences.english: China is transforming the world as it transforms itself.
sentences.chinese: 中国正在像转变自身那样来转变世界。

sentences.english: She was never flighty like you.
sentences.chinese: 她从来不像你这样胡思乱想。

sentences.english: Like Stephen, I tend to be somewhat contrary by nature.
sentences.chinese: 像斯蒂芬一样，我也是生来倾向逆向思考。

sentences.english: The controls line up so that they can be read like an English sentence.
sentences.chinese: 控件整队排列，使它们读起来像一个英语句子。

sentences.english: Lateef says conditions like these keep small farmers in poverty.
sentences.chinese: Lateef女士说，像这样的条件下保持贫穷小农。

sentences.english: Like the rain back in Canada that later turned to sleet.
sentences.chinese: 雨最终转化为雨夹雪，就像在加拿大那样。

sentences.english: Are you like Maggie and George, stuck living in the suburbs?
sentences.chinese: 是否像M和乔治那样，在市郊呆板地生活？

definition: heel/to follow closely/to go with/(of a woman) to marry sb/with/compared with/to/towards/and (joining two nouns)
seemingly/apparently/looks as if/appear to be/gives the impression that/seems on the face of it to be
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
variant of 彷彿|仿佛[fang3 fu2]
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
